intro: Castelaria erecta, commonly known as the upright castelaria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Commelinaceae. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas and is characterized by its tall, erect growth habit. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically arranged in dense clusters. Castelaria erecta thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
